Overcome by a fleeting moment of helplessness, the group gazes distantly as the sun begins to set upon the village.

Two years have passed since the battle against Sephiroth, and just as the world has begun to rebuild, a mysterious plague strikes the city of Midgar.
Geostigma, a deadly disease with no known cure, is spreading fast, and to make matters worse, new enemies threaten the planet's hard-won peace.
Cloud, however, is unable to face this latest threat.
Racked with guilt from the lives he couldn't save, a question haunts him at every turn: "Are sins ever forgiven?"
After coming to terms with the past, Cloud at last finds the will to stand and fight.
But what do these new enemies want? What is the true nature of this enigmatic disease?
And is there hope left for humanity?

Cloud and Tifa tear through the wastelands on his motorcycle Fenrir to help their comrades.
The Remnant Kadaj, who seeks revenge against the planet, has summoned a horde of monsters to attack Midgar.
Cloud's friends rush to the scene, but they stand no chance against such powerful foes.
Memories of battles from days past and the sacrifices made weigh heavily on Cloud. But as Tifa holds tight to him, she senses that this once-broken man has at last regained his will to fight.

At last, the tale of revenge against the planet comes to an end.
As Cloud holds the dying Kadaj in his arms, the silver-haired man begins to fade away.
Manipulated by both Sephiroth and his "mother" Jenova, Kadaj─aided by the other Remnants─committed the most heinous acts of violence. Cloud, however, cannot help but sympathize with this man.
After all, he too had been led astray by Sephiroth.
And so Cloud, having saved the planet once more, quietly bids farewell to his "brother," who returns to the lifestream.

An esper revered as the Savior in a certain land. Horses were the lifeblood of this small nation, which struggled to defend its independence in an age of war. It once saw the rare birth of twin foals—but they were small and fragile, unfit to serve in war. Tasked with their disposal, a recruit led them into the icy mountains, never to return.
Months passed, and as a larger power besieged the struggling nation, its end seemed inevitable. But then, into the fray charged a champion—a dazzling figure atop
a chariot drawn by the once-discarded twin foals, now grown robust and magnificent. Hailed as a saint, she defended her homeland tirelessly, her steeds bearing the weight of countless battles. When the champions finally fell, consumed by the blaze of their valor, the people's grief lifted their souls and chariot aloft. A vision of saint and heavenly steeds tore across the sky, turning the enemy army to ice before receding skyward.

In the dark of night, deep in the woods, and amid the wail of dreadful beasts, Lucielle and Sharlze are ambushed. Looking on at the scene, anyone would bemoan the princess's fate—for they were frail-looking maidens, circled by leering thieves.
Lucielle's vacant smile claims sheepishness, but she gathers vile magic in her hand behind her back. Noting her sister's movements, Shalze grins, turning to face the bandits. As the boom tears through the air and the stink of singed flesh fills her nostrils, Shalze gasps with mirth despite herself—this dull midnight stroll has begun to turn interesting. "This is hardly enough," Lucielle mutters into the blackness, a smile blooming across her features. Indeed, the night has just begun, and the fey princesses of Ovis will stain the darkness red.

"SEIFER. DRINK?"
"........."
"...Can I drink somethin'? I'd like some water, ya know."
"...IGNORE."

"WHAT?"
"Yo, it's Squall. Oh yeah, Fujin's gonna treat, ya know? Want somethin'?"
"RAGE!"
"!!!!!!!!!"

"...Squall, can't you see the disciplinary committee's busy? Don't bother us."

While battling upon the flatlands somewhere...

"Lasswell. Fina. Both of you sure look different from before."

"I'll assure you it isn't just looks that's different. I'm very much a different person now."

"Me too! I can pose pretty lewdly now! Mmm...! How's that!?"

"Hey, Lasswell... What happened to her...?"

"Well... Things just happened, that's all... Never mind that, we've got enemies to focus on!"

And with this, Rain, Lasswell, and Fina's journey continues.

For Resnick, the beach with summer in full swing is a special place where she feels free to be her true self. She visits her location of choice for another year in a row, but this time, she brings a new friend along.
"Well, Kilphe? I take it you are glad you came."
"This kind of thing is certainly nice from time to time. I suppose I might not be used to such leisure."
"Then it was the right decision to invite you."
With a pleased look on her face, Resnick presents two drinks: one that is beautiful like a clear sky and another that is glorious like the setting sun. A glint appears in Kilphe's eye at the sight of these unfamiliar beverages—a level of cheerful excitement that Resnick has, unsurprisingly, never seen in her companion before.
They clink their glasses together and smile as they gaze at the brilliant blue above the beach and beyond the shore. This shared respite, however brief, will likely give rise to an ever deeper friendship.

A legendary esper of the distant east whose appearance in ancient times inspired terror. In times of peace, it slumbers deeply within the molten rivers of a dormant volcano. However, when chaos reigns and the land grows inundated with the ills of humankind, it awakes in a fury.
Its scorching breath and the lava spewed in its wake reach temperatures capable of melting iron. Over countless ages, this molten flow has cooled and solidified, forming the infamous mountain of trials in the east. Legends tell of an ancient, mighty nation that the Yatsuka-no-Orochi decimated overnight, leaving not even ashes behind. The islands dotting the east today are said to be remnants of that once-great land. A champion arose in the east who subdued Yatsuka-no-Orochi through trickery, lulling it back to sleep. Now, the beast answers the call of those who possess this hero's spirit, whereupon its rancor may be channeled instead as a pure, cleansing flame.

An ornithic esper feared for terrible storms within which it is wreathed. By freely controlling air currents, it can create a tornado around itself and deliver a barrage of attacks as tumultuous as a tempest. Also known for its fierce temperament, it is said that Garuda once reduced a town to ruins in an instant with a storm it summoned on a whim.
Though many have challenged the birdlike esper to battle, most of them do not live to tell the tale. On rare occasions, challengers have been allowed to live after being acknowledged for their strength, as Garuda believes that anyone with fierce courage comparable to its own will go on to gain the power to fight like a completely different warrior during their next encounter.

An astrologer does not gaze upon the stars to discern their messages—they listen to the faint, unique voice of each light. These voices, however, often speak even when one does not wish to hear. Ramada has heard many ominous whispers over her lifetime. And until now, she has not divulged these warnings to her allies unless asked. She has not had to—for time and again, she and her friends have managed to avert the grim fates foretold for them. No doubt it is lonely, though, to grapple with the dark murmurs of the stars in solitary silence.
No one knows the true nature of the voices from the stars. Like to astrologers, a voice that cannot be placed speaks to the oracles; who owns this voice and from whence it issues, none can say. But one thing is invariably true: its utterances always contain the word "lectura."

Having seen the overwhelming threat that is the «Realmscourge» with their own eyes, Lilyth and Adelard were on the brink of despair.
The two had never waivered in their will to fight no matter what stood before them, but now, their spirits were about to break. And yet, in the midst of despair, Mont and his hope stood defiant in the face of the «Realmscourge». Witnessing such a sight before them, the two steadied their resolve and rose to their feet once more.

Tension clung to the air of the war council, and the silence was palpable the moment Lilyth and Adelard made their entrance. The eyes of the pair, sunken with despair but moments ago, were now ablaze. Lilyth nodded with conviction in agreement to the plan Adelard laid before the council, instilling hope in the hearts of the soldiers once more.
It was not yet time to resign oneself to fate. So long as they draw breath, they would fight against it—for Ardra's future.

When the world was shrouded in darkness, the Goddess of Mana drew forth the Sword of Mana to smite the eight Benevodons, monsters of destruction.
She sealed the horrors inside the eight Mana Stones, bringing the realm back from the brink. Weakened from rebuilding the world, the Goddess changed herself into a tree and fell into a deep sleep for many years.
However, the forces of evil soon sought to free the Benevodons to gain control of the world.
They started a terrible war to further their plot and destabilize the kingdoms.
Peace was at an end. Mana itself began to disappear from the world and the Mana Tree started to wither...

Jayden fights on the frontline against a horde of monsters that have been tormenting his people. His assault was so fierce the battle seemed as it if would end as soon as it started, yet the enemy was endless, surging forth again and again in great numbers.
It was then that Duran and Angela, a soldier and a magician from another world, came running in.
Would these people, whom Jayden had only just met, truly lend themselves to his cause?
They fell the monsters in quick succession as he watches in amazement. His eyes glisten at the sight of techniques and magic he had never seen before, causing him to clutch his weapons with newfound strength.
And so begins his peculiar alliance with the warriors from another world.

Roaring thunder and violent sparks fill the battlefield as the visions of Veritas of the Bolt and Veritas of the Light collide head-on.
Watching intently as Jayden and Shurecca command the visions with ease, the Crimson Wizard cracks an unseen smile.
His arrival in another world was unplanned, but in doing so he stumbled upon this new power—a power with which he could obtain anything and everything.
He fires his magic, enhanced to the fullest, at the crystal held by Shurecca, filling it in an instant and instilling it with an insidious light.
As everyone is taken off guard and unable to act, the Crimson Wizard easily takes control of the crystal and summons Veritas of the Bolt—and in doing so, bares the fangs of his insatiable desire for power.

A young Sadali and Exia stand hand-in-hand, their eyes beaming with pride and their hearts full of nothing but inextinguishable hope.
Gilgamesh fixes his sight upon their backs as if praying over them. He and Amnelis have finally found a beacon of light in the seemingly inescapable darkness they have wandered for hundreds of years.
Though the young pair may seem weak and unreliable now, they will undoubtedly grow stronger and shine brighter as they continue on their long journey, illuminating the way towards a better future.
Their journey will be full of hardships, and there will be many days that see them broken and beaten time and time again. But so long as they never give up, they will surely reach the place they seek, for no longer do they walk in darkness with nothing to guide them. No matter how dark or hopeless the night may seem, the light is with them.

In a little town tucked away in a corner of Tessera, two hearts came together on a night blessed with gentle rain, unaware that they had just taken the first step on a journey along a path of hardship that would span hundreds of years.
From that fateful day when they took their places on the longboat that would take them across the dark and deadly sea, they believed there would always be hope—and that hope endured without end, even when the ebb and flow of time saw them pushed apart. Even when the cruelty of fate had its way with Sadali and drew him into darkness, Exia held onto the light at the very depths of that abyss.
The future they had first envisioned was still beyond them, but Exia believed—that one day they would walk a path of abundant light, together.

"Did you hear, Alaya? Looks like the 'ruler beneath the crimson moon' and his bunch lost to the Exorcists."
"That seems to be the case. Let's scout things out from above to improve our own chances this time around. To the broom, Frederika."
"Oh, good thinking! Then let's take to the skies, lickety-split!"

In a certain season, strange and wicked demons appear, parading through the streets at night, sowing mischief and mayhem as they please. And in response, the Exorcists rush to the scene to terrify the demons and drive them away.
Although the demons have suffered defeat every year, it seems that they have done their planning and have come up with a proper strategy for victory this time. The two appear to be enjoying soaring through the evening air, but unbeknownst to them an altercation unfolds at the tip of the broom. It would appear the souls in their stuffed toys have some unfinished business from their previous lives...

In a vast desert wasteland created from the ruins of an ancient kingdom, strange monsters with the appearance of cacti began to appear. Small and nimble, they made for difficult foes to bring down, yet despite this, the people did not particularly fear them. And so it was, until an enormous sandstorm struck a small town at the edge of the desert. Just as the winds and dust clouds were about to engulf the townspeople, the Jumbo Cactuar emerged from the raging sands. It is believed that the Jumbo Cactuar survived for many years, growing to gargantuan proportions—with a body the size of a small mountain and incredible strength, it struck fear into the hearts of the desert's residents. It is rumored amongst the people that the grudge held by those who once lived in the destroyed kingdom amalgamated within the gigantic cactuar, eventually transforming it.

Having learned that Lake Dorr was polluted, Luka the water priestess makes her way to the lake—just as the Veritas of the Waters had planned. By luring Luka to the lake, the Veritas of the Waters would be able to end her life. However...

"My, my. What a pathetically obvious plan."

"You...you ambushed my ambush?
Have you no decency!?"

Nichol saw through the Veritas of the Waters's scheme and was able to successfully turn the tables and ambush the ambusher by surrounding the lake with the aid of Rain and the others.

The light of dawn filtered into the dimly lit corridor, marking the beginning of the next act in a battle of fates.
Standing in the quiet passage of his castle, Jayden decided to close his eyes and take a moment before departing for the field of battle.
Through sheer force of will had he awoken, and he was ready. His mind was at peace, despite the impending terror of the «Realmscourge» and the crisis imposed by Heindler's occupation of his castle. His body was strong, despite the many moons he spent bedridden.
Determination renewed, he opened his eyes, and as if in response, the sound of boots on stone echoed along the corridor. Turning around, he was greeted by his most trusted companions lined up before him, eyes burning with conviction.
Jayden gave them a little grin and a quick nod, then took a step forward—a step into a new history that they would forge together.

The Gullwings are sphere hunters, explorers who make their living collecting the ancient spheres scattered throughout the various regions of Spira. Its star hunting party is the eponymous trio "YRP"—named for members Yuna, Rikku, and Paine.
The Gullwings are the sole sphere hunting group to own an airship, an advantage which allows them to soar from place to place at almost instantaneous speeds as they gather spheres, and the information within, for reasons known only to them. The name "Gullwings" is said to be inspired by the experience they had when discovering their airship, the Celsius.
Though the group's leader is supposed to be Brother, people far and wide assume this honor sits with Yuna.

The lively young Al Bhed girl. Daughter of Cid, the leader of the Al Bhed, and little sister to Brother, she is also a cousin to Yuna on the summoner's mother's side. Rikku previously served as Yuna's youngest guardian during her pilgrimage two years prior, where she gave her all in search of a way to carry out their mission without having to sacrifice Yuna's life.
After the onset of the Eternal Calm, she traveled across Spira with her fellow Al Bhed to spread their mechanical knowledge. In the wake of the "truth" movement, she changed course, founding the Gullwings sphere hunter organization with her brother. Eventually, she roused Yuna from her lethargy and persuaded her to leave Besaid and join the Gullwings.
The official "merry maker" of the Gullwings, her vivaciousness and unreliable intuition can cause problems for the group on occasion, but her boundless optimism, even in the face of difficulties, never fails to keep everyone's spirits high.

The holy night has arrived once again. Lost in thought, Perrene stares at the evening sky and the falling snow.
"Why do you choose to be gloomy on today of all days!?"
A startled Perrene turns to see Raph in her appropriately festive outfit with a familiar, old sleigh.
"Raphie, what is the sleigh for?"
"Oh, uh, it was sort of just stored away, so I brought it out. Seems exactly like what we needed."
The sleigh, once used to fly through the holy-night sky, had been made for Perrene by Kalidra, a previous Warrior of the Crystals. Raph had no way of knowing this, of course, but the sight of Raph laughing like him brought back nostalgic memories for Perrene.
With Raph sitting by her side—innocent eyes bright as holiday lights—Perrene quietly prays for these days to be everlasting.

A talented sword fighter who joined the Gullwings shortly before Yuna. Seemingly mature beyond her years and generally taciturn, it often falls to her to keep the more carefree members of the group in line. She is quick with cynicism and sarcastic barbs whenever she believes her fellow Gullwings are getting too boisterous, but beneath the reserved demeanor she is far from a killjoy. Though extremely guarded, she does have her quirks, such as keeping a mental tally of "respect points" she has for the people she meets. It seems she joined the Gullwings because of something that happened in her past, yet none of the Gullwings know exactly what that might be. She is known for her hostile one-liners such as "here comes the hurt," and "I'm gonna carve you up."

Having defeated the despair of the Final Days, the Warrior of Light and their comrades had resumed walking their respective paths.
Yet fate would see them reunited for a mission unto another reflection, and now an unexpected petition has arrived beckoning them west─to the faraway continent of Tural.

The Warrior of Light embarks upon a new adventure where fresh faces and unknown battles await...

With the cycle of life restored to Alexandria, its people will once more live and die as creation had intended, with the legacy of one generation being passed down to the next.
Thus carrying the memories of those you met in your heart, you look to the journeys still ahead.
As you continue walking your path, you may collide with others and your steps may falter.

But come what may, you find encouragement in the knowledge that the world shall ever be filled with wonders awaiting discovery.

Once upon a sunny afternoon in Hourne, a gentle breeze ushered the sweet scent of flowers into the sun-blessed courtyard of the castle. It was a brief moment of peace for Machérie and Vinera, who had brought their children to the gardens. They sat and spoke of matters they rarely had the leisure to consider—the future and the hope they held for it.
They knew the future that the babies in their arms would go on to forge would be one without war—an age of true peace. What will they grow up to be like?
As the mothers mused, the little ones slept soundly.
What kind of adventures were they having in their dreams? Machérie and Vinera shared a knowing look and a smile that spoke only of happiness.

Enkidu!
I trust you can take care of the rest!

Ahem! Faithful sidekick? ...Enkidu?

Hey! Sidekicks do NOT ditch the hero!

The unrelenting Frostlord, Veritas of the Frost, deals a bone-chilling blow as the wicked and cruel Waterlord, Veritas of the Waters, gracefully delivers retribution.

Only demise awaits those who witness this deadly duet.

Galuf. It's good to see you again...
Mwa-hahahahaha!

Crystals!
Obey my magic... Give me your power!
Smite these vermin!

Hah! The crystals have been destroyed!
Your world will be next, Galuf!

The Leonis brothers stand side-by-side, and a shining pair of wings forms between them as the winged appendages extending from their backs align.
Mont became a leader, holding fast to the path he believed in regardless of the pain and suffering that accompanied it as he united once-divided nations and people alike. Sterne chose the dark, isolated path into the shadows, from which he worked tirelessly to find a means to defeat the «Realmscourge».
Now, their paths cross once more—and thus, the wheels of fate have begun to turn.
The twin lions shall soar, and they will be the light of hope to which the people look.

The Veritas of the Earth acts as a bulwark on the battlefield by shutting down every attack with his shield as the Veritas of the Bolt vanquishes their foes from behind him with a storm of thunderous arrows.

Never-ending is this duo's destructive feast.

First discovered in the steep mountainous region of another world, this esper has caused concern for humans with its troubling propensity to explode on a massive scale when attacked.
Initially, people believed that this giant bomb was just a normal bomb that grew to an enormous size, but it came to be known as the Dad Bomb due to the way it shows up to protect smaller bombs when they are in danger. A similar Mom Bomb also exists, and the two are thought to be a couple.
Dad Bomb's instinct to protect his bomb children is strong; as such, anyone attempting to cause them harm can expect Dad Bomb to swell up and unleash an intense barrage of attacks.

Back when she was referred to as "Sorrow," Falsette saw the Sanctum as a place to be loathed rather than a place she could call home. But now, having learned the sentiments veiled beneath the demeanors of "Whisper" and her other sisters, she has come to see the Sanctum as a warm and welcoming home where her family awaits. Originally created as homunculi from different sections of Exia's body, Falsette and the others began to gradually develop human emotions and become akin to blood-related sisters. Now, the four unite once more to support Exia as she exhausts what little of her life force remains to save Ardra. Falsette smiled in elation at the sight of her sisters in matching pure white garb—the very same smile that instilled hope in the three and spurred them to rename her. Thus, the four snow-white sisters stand together on the battlefield, ready to protect the home and loved ones they hold dear.

A large mechanical scorpion that guards the innermost section of Mako Reactor 1 in the city of Midgar in a distant world. It eliminates intruders using a wide variety of live ammunitions and direct-energy weapons, including its Tail Laser, a destructive beam so powerful it can blow apart even blocks of iron with ease. Not only capable of close combat, it can also display astounding mobility by leaping and clinging to high places such as walls, using the vantage to make long-range attacks.
This formidable machine forced even a former member of the elite group SOLDIER and a leader of an activist group into a long, grueling battle.

A Vision born from the Ice Queen Shiva's resonation with the noble ideals of Lasswell, who labors in a land far from Ardra. Lasswell's Purple Lightning and Shiva's blizzards dance beautifully across the battlefield in order to rein in the mayhem which has run supreme for ages. The indomitable spirit which courses through this resolve conceals an intense flame hidden in ice.

Over the past 25 years, Lara Croft has uncovered lost tombs, solved ingenious puzzles, bested treacherous traps, and saved the world a few times over. She's also become a pop-culture icon who has inspired countless fans around the world to embrace their adventurous side and to "just keep moving" through challenging times. Here's to another 25 years, Lara.

The Azure Crystal has been passed down through generations of warriors. Starlight Elena, in whose heart the flames of justice burn bright, turned the crystal's power into twin blades that she uses to battle evil wherever she finds it.
This is the cover illustration from the much anticipated latest issue of the Fundamental Forces graphic novel series, which tells the stories of the heroes who protect the world.

In an ethereal forest shrouded by silence and the scent of floral fragrances, a weary Fryevia gives herself a moment of respite from her journey. Trails of light filter through the trees, touching upon the beauty of her porcelain features as she gazes into the distance. Does she yearn for the homeland of her memories, or does her heart quietly race at the thought of the unknown warrior with whom she will next cross blades?

The tale of Ardra welcomes its second year. Warriors traverse time and space to honor the day this saga of heroes, which is now talked about the world over, came into existence. Just for this occasion, their normally gallant expressions transform into festive smiles as they rejoice over the arrival of this celebratory day. In this moment, they promise each other that they will all make greater strides during the third year of their fateful journey.

The tale of Ardra welcomes its second year. Countless heroes traverse time and space to take part in the celebration. Though these partygoers are amongst mortal enemies with whom they fight merciless wars, today is the one occasion where they chat, raise a glass to one another, and enjoy a meal together.
A pleasant conversation leaves an inadvertent smile on Mont's face during a fleeting moment of peace. Though he and his comrades must confront a harsh fate, it would seem that for just a brief moment, they are able to forget the fighting to revel in this joyous occasion.

The tale of Ardra welcomes its second year. Countless heroes traverse time and space to take part in the celebration. Though these partygoers are amongst mortal enemies with whom they fight merciless wars, today is the one occasion where they chat, raise a glass to one another, and enjoy a meal together.
Thanks to the amicable atmosphere of the venue, relaxation seeps its way into the normally gallant expressions of these warriors. Even the mighty Zazan appears satisfied with the hearty feast that awaits him.

An enigmatic esper that tyrannized another world. Though its appearance resembles that of Odin, it is rumored that a different kind of power flows within this entity.
A summoner once feared far and wide as the "Dark Lord" was said to have bestowed his terrifying powers upon the esper when his life came to an end, but how much of this is true remains unclear.
The only thing that is certain is the immeasurable malice and loathing it bears towards humankind.

The ancient War of Magi.
When its flames at last receded, only the charred husk of a world remained. Even the power of magic was lost.
In the thousand years that followed, iron, gunpowder, and steam engines took the place of magic, and life slowly returned to the barren land.
Yet there now stands one who would reawaken the magic of ages past, and use its dread power as a means by which to conquer all the world.
Could anyone truly be foolish enough to repeat that mistake?

It is said that the "True King" will save the world of Eos when crisis befalls it. At the age of five, Noctis, the prince of Lucis, was chosen by the Crystal to take this role.
To aid the True King, there also exists an "Oracle" that is said to purify and bring stability to the world. Lunafreya, a young woman of Tenebrae, was born into the Oracle's bloodline and appointed to wed Noctis.
Though the two only spoke together as children, they never forgot the oath they swore to fulfill their respective callings.

Magitek armor developed by the Niflheim Empire, a military state in a distant world.
It is equipped with tremendously powerful weapons, such as a machine gun at the bottom of the cockpit and a javelin that it plunges into the ground to electroshock surrounding enemies.
The Niflheim Empire paved its way to becoming a major power by using its magiteknology to develop an arsenal of mechanized weaponry such as the Maniple.

"I have something a little different cooked up for this year's Holy Night treat."
"Ooh, it's packed to the brim! There's never a dull moment with you and your devious ways, is there?"
"Heh. Well, if they want to stick with me, they shall need to be able to take take this sort of thing in their stride—and with a smile to boot!"
"Haha! This is shaping up to be a real night to remember!"
"It'll be gorgeous! We shall light up the night sky like never before."

"I know the look of villainy when I see it... Just what are you two plotting?"

"All right, today is a joyous day, the likes of which we rarely see! No need for modesty—eat and drink to your heart's content! Make merry!"
"If we do as you say, we shall be paying for our revelry tomorrow."
"You always worry too much, my friend!"
A lavish banquet takes place atop the ship's deck, basked in the light of the morning sun. It appears that the soldiers who usually spend their days on the battlefield have also taken the opportunity to let loose and enjoy themselves today.
"No harm in having a day like this, don't you agree? The days blood is spilt on the battlefield and the days we drink ourselves silly—all of it is a part of my great story. And I won't forget a moment until the day I die."
"King Jayden..."
"Haha! Even after Ardra is united as one, I hope we can revel like this together once more. Let us forge the future together! What do you say, Oberon?"
"Of course!"

Tyrrell slowly makes his way through the stillness of the underground passage, paying special attention to his surroundings.
He places Grahl and Rayches, whom he had just debilitated with a sleep-inducing substance, in an underground prison cell and finally takes a moment to breathe. A faint light, looking as though it could go out at any moment, wavers in the darkness.
Grahl, still barely conscious, clasps onto the iron bars while glowering at Tyrrell. The boy closes the cell door with quivering hands, murmuring an apology.
He tells himself that this was the only way to help them...that if he were stronger, there might have been some other way. But right now, he finds himself barely capable of protecting even one person, let alone two.
Tyrrell looks downward, gazing at his own hands—the hands of a child. But he quickly holds his head high and looks forward.
For he must overcome the hardships that have befallen him, and attain the power to protect those he holds dear.

Within «Nitor», the second division of Hourne, quarrels have a way of breaking out on a regular basis between Salire and Rayches. The focus of their heated displays: the division commander, Adelard.
One day, the usual dispute between Salire and Rayches had begun when Grahl was resting after returning from a military exercise. Completely exhausted, Grahl fell asleep despite the commotion. The next morning, he was awoken by a visit from the glum faces of Salire and Rayches. They said that due to their fighting, one of the pillars in Hourne Castle had been destroyed, and Adelard was subsequently furious.
For the next few days, Grahl was dragged into their discussions—and constant bickering—about how to get Adelard to forgive them. Grahl's stomach was stricken with pain from the stress of it all, and he has since vowed to always put a stop to their bickering before it's too late.

An esper bound in chains and sealed within the depths of the abyss. Immensely powerful, many renowned mages forfeited their lives to seal Anima away.
The darkness it bears within, born from loathing and anguish, has transformed it into a sinister sight to behold, but this esper was once gentle and devoid of any maliciousness.
It is said overexposure to human animosity caused Anima to frenzy, spiraling it into a fiendish existence of unending destruction.

An aeon summoned from the fayth statue of Besaid Island by a hopeful summoner in a faraway world called Spira.
The gales raised by its wings and the rays it emits are intensely powerful, making this aeon one its summoner can depend on.
The girl who became a full-fledged summoner upon calling forth Valefor would go on to undertake a rigorous journey accompanied by her guardians to defeat the giant fiend Sin.

Long has the antagonism between Gilgamesh and Sadali endured. Gilgamesh, a being with god-like powers that enable him to break earthly bonds and soar in the heavens, and Sadali, a miraculous man himself possessing great magic that well exceeds the limits of mere mortals. Their fated showdown will surely be a battle so terrible it shakes all creation.
The two have differing goals, but their methods have been the same: interfering with the nations of Ardra in order to bring about wars. They can never turn back because they have marched for eons, holding onto things that they cannot cede to one another. Therefore, it seemed inevitable that they would someday clash.
Does peace or ruin lie at the culmination of their paths? No matter the outcome, it is almost a certainty that innumerable souls will perish along the way.

Along their journey, Helena and the others found themselves searching for a source of water to relieve their thirst. They came across an abundance of beautiful fruit growing deep within a forest. The fruit, with its unfamiliar form and brilliant color, causes Eliza to hesitate, but Rafale doesn't waste a moment before picking one and sinking her teeth into it. Eliza almost begins to panic, but Helena's calm voice reassures her.
Upon closer inspection, it would seem birds and beasts have consumed their share, indicating the harmless nature of the fruits. With the arduous journey that awaits them after their brief respite, Eliza decides that bringing a bundle of fruit might serve them well. She reaches out to pick another, but Helena gently stops her, explaining that the inhabitants of the forest rely on the fruit as a food source, and thus they should not take more than they immediately need. Embarrassed, Eliza nods and takes a bite of the single fruit she had picked. The fruit of life's dulcet blessing quenches her thirst.

Fina and Dark Fina. For both of them, their counterpart is an irreplaceable "other self."
Though they are the spitting image of each other, their personalities are exact opposites—one pure and innocent, the other fierce and alluring.
However, all who have come into contact with them agree that they share the same, characteristic consideration for others.
The Finas are resolute in watching over their beloved companions, and the world through which they journeyed together.

She was once a very gifted princess who supported her beloved, foolish brother. Fearing her tactical prowess, her brother and his queen decided to poison her, but she saw through their plot and escaped.
Later, with the help of many, she wreaks vengeance on her land, and kills her brother with her own hands.
After the ordeal, she disappeared, only to be found later in the form of a plant that feeds off her vices so that she can maintain her sanity.

Lightning, a former security agent of the floating continent of Cocoon, and Odin, the Eidolon that fights by her side.
Having transformed into a white horse, Odin gallops over the battlefield as Lightning wields his giant sword with splendor from upon his back.
In this world, Eidolons only come to the aid of l'Cie that they deem worthy, and for the l'Cie burdened with Focuses to fulfill, they are most reassuring allies.

Hope, an upper-class boy from the floating continent of Cocoon, and Alexander, the Eidolon that fights by his side.
Alexander, appearing in response to Hope's call, follows his summoner's commands to unleash divine judgment upon the enemies that would assail them.
In this world, Eidolons only come to the aid of l'Cie that they deem worthy, and for the l'Cie burdened with Focuses to fulfill, they are most reassuring allies.

Snow, a young man who leads an anti-Sanctum organization in the floating continent of Cocoon, and Shiva, the Eidolons that fight by his side.
The Shiva sisters, having transformed into a large and imposing motorcycle, lend their strength to Snow to blissfully tear up the battlefield.
In this world, Eidolons only come to the aid of l'Cie that they deem worthy, and for the l'Cie burdened with Focuses to fulfill, they are most reassuring allies.

A quartet of enigmatic espers that tyrannized another world. Though their appearance resembles that of the Tetra Sylphid sisters, it is rumored that a different kind of power flows within these entities.
A summoner once feared far and wide as the "Dark Lord" was said to have bestowed his terrifying powers upon these espers when his life came to an end, but how much of this is true remains unclear.
Certainly, they are malicious beings that loathe humankind and summon tempests and storms of destruction, but some legends say they were once cheerful, carefree spirits that liked nothing better than a good chat.

To save Leonis from a dire threat, Ramada went alone to Rundall Castle to kneel before Jayden's throne.
She believed that the future could be changed, if the king would only heed her petition.
However, Jayden refused to act, not even sending reinforcements. With no other recourse, Ramada then revealed her true identity, and told him everything that was happening in Wezette.
Of King Mont of Leonis, of his potential, of the mysterious power within him and the destiny that guides his actions—inscrutible even to the star-reading Ramada herself.
It was a power that even forced Khury to play his trump card, and when Jayden heard this, his eyes glittered from their depths.
"How interesting," said the king to himself, and Ramada smiled as she saw a new star begin to shine.

Bathed in gentle late-afternoon sunshine, she poured sweet-smelling tea into her favorite cup. Alaya loved those small garden parties with her brother Oberon and Rivelka. As she listened to Oberon talk, she would cast a glittering eye over the colorful array of sweets. Oberon sometimes talked about the hardships of past times, but he also spoke of Jayden as a stalwart ally in the face of them.
The Jayden of Oberon's memory lived vividly in Alaya's heart, too.
Since then, however, much time has passed, and the turmoil of war gradually has clouded the bright memories. The demons of suspicion took hold of Oberon, blinding him to the truth, and Alaya, too, was driven once more into pointless battle. She still believes, however, that those happy, peaceful days will return.

A planning meeting at a major toy manufacturer. Proposal after proposal is rejected as continuous and harsh criticisms from the executives bring down the mood.
Alaya, having reached her third year at the organization, is able to make her first proposal after weeks of nearly debilitating distress. She approaches this opportunity with confidence after receiving help and positive feedback from one of her seniors, who simply claimed her proposal was "interesting." Unfortunately, she is unable to properly put her thoughts into words in the overwhelming presence of the executives. In response, that very same senior who helped her stands up and speaks with brave eloquence—Alaya's fears vanish, and she is able to give the rest of her presentation without issue.
Her proposal is approved and the product is met with extraordinary reception, but by that point the senior who had her back is no longer at the company. Having started his own business in the same field, he is now a rival. Alaya's motivation is taken to new heights, but that is a story for another day.

A popular young woman from another world, who suddenly found herself in the lands of Ardra, and Mont, who escorts her on her unexpected journey.
With wonderful dance skills and never-ending positivity, the beautiful Addison charms everyone in her path.
It is rumored that, even before her arrival, she had fans in Ardra who somehow followed her exploits, but the truth of this will likely remain a mystery.

"Last year's monsters were driven off into the dawn, but this year will be different, because this year, the Underqueen herself shall lead them. Isn't that so, Lu'Cia? Creysse?"
"Those exorcists will never stand a chance against Underqueen Salire."
"Are we sure about that? I mean, they seem so very powerful, and...terrifyingly muscular, too."

In a certain season, strange and wicked demons appear, parading through the streets at night, sowing mischief and mayhem as they please. And in response, the Exorcists rush to the scene to terrify the demons and drive them away. But this year, the famous underqueen has decided to join the fun, promising to make this Halloween the spookiest one yet!

Thin streams of smoke rise from the flames unleashed by the enemy. Images of Frederika's late brother come to her as she sprints in an attempt to rescue her people.
Her brother's life was lost doing the same—fighting for the People of the Forest. At first, sadness was all that Frederika could feel about her brother leaving her. She wanted more time together. With her homeland in danger before her very eyes, however, she could clearly hear his words once again.
"I shall not fail. Even if it costs me my life, I will protect you, and I will protect this forest we call home."
Frederika finally felt as if she understood what was in his heart. She shuts her eyes.
"I want to protect this forest and everyone in it."
Opening her eyes once again, she sees two figures watching over her: Engelbert and Eurel. She sees that she is not alone.
In order to protect the people she loves and stand victorious, she will go beyond the flames.

An enigmatic esper that tyrannized another world. Though its appearance resembles that of Ramuh, it is rumored that a different kind of power flows within this entity.
A summoner once feared far and wide as the "Dark Lord" was said to have bestowed his terrifying powers upon the esper when his life came to an end, but how much of this is true remains unclear.
It is said that this esper came to despise the human race for its repeated mistakes and never-ending crimes, even to the point of wishing destruction upon it. Yet, this powerful entity was once admired as an elder sage that used its wisdom to save and guide lost souls.

Majellan and Mindini encountered Prince Mont Leonis and his division «Caelum», and together they worked to return the two monsters to their world. However, due to ever-mounting mishaps, a herd of monsters from the same world as Majellan and Mindini were inadvertently summoned.
The members of «Caelum» were then forced to fight against powerful enemies they had never laid eyes on before, but they persevered admirably with Majellan's knowledge about the monsters and Mindini's passionate support from the sidelines. But alas, a great presence would later appear before them to bar their way...

Late at night as the villagers sleep, the beautiful sound of a flute resounds throughout the silence-enshrouded village. The timbre of the player adorns the dark night in eerie and bewitching tones, leaving a mysterious and melancholy aura to tint the air.
When the timbre of the flute fades into the darkness, the player, too, is nowhere to be seen.

The second division of the kingdom of Leonis, «Caelum», was returning home after a battle with Fennes near the border. Learte, tasked with reconnaissance, went ahead of the rest of the division. She could see far into the distance on this clear day, and it was clear that something unusual was occurring in the woods near their planned marching route.
When Learte reached the forest, she witnessed bloodthirsty monsters hounding after someone. She calmly defeated the monsters only to find that some monsters she had never seen before remained. Just as she was about to let loose her arrow, the monsters spoke, expressing their gratitude—and dumbfounding Learte in the process.
The tale that ensues is one of the inhabitants of different worlds working together, if only for a little while, prompted by their sun-speckled encounter under the canopy of the forest.

A discreet smile forms on Perrene's face as Raph takes the lead ahead of the younger Lucio and braves another battle. As Perrene observes Raph's gallantry, she recalls fond memories of another courageous figure.
The days before Raph awakened as a Warrior, when she fought alongside the former Warrior of the Dark Crystal, were all coming back to her.
She had believed that they would walk the same path together for an eternity. Unfortunately, the end of such peace and happiness came suddenly. In order to complete his mission, he would sacrifice himself, and as he disappeared, Perrene could not shed a tear. She could only stand motionless as he smiled at her. Surely, he had no regrets. The former Warriors of the Crystals have passed their wills onto Raph and Lucio, an action that links the Warriors' souls of the past, present, and future. And though those Warriors may be long gone, they will continue to walk beside their comrades and successors until the end of time.

The Wezette winter is long and harsh, but offers beauty and marvels all of its own. In the annual snow festival, spires of ice glitter with multicolored illumination, while starlight seems to fall from the sky and sparkle on the white-shrouded land.
The members of Glaciela's private brigade, «Spirare», make their own fond memories of winter. One night during the festival, Meriluke and Cherise build snow sculptures together. Meriluke finds a branch that perfectly resembles a stag's antlers and stands ready to crown the finished sculpture. Cherise carefully places a hat on its head, and Cadia arranges a scarf about its neck. She then hurries off to fetch Glaciela, excited to show her the result of their efforts. Minwu holds out a hand to catch the soft snow, and watches the delicate crystals melt in the warmth of her palm. She thinks about their fleeting beauty, and how memories of cold winter nights can warm people's hearts.

The War of the Gale Highlands was over, and for a time at least, peace settled over the land. One day, Mont gave Machérie a single yellow flower, but said nothing of his true feelings. He knew that if he did, Machérie would be forced to face a difficult decision that loomed over her. Instead, the flower was the message―he would always protect her, even if she could never be his. Machérie understood, and could not help but weep.
When Engelbert learned that Mont and Machérie were ready to forsake their love for each other, he sprang into action. He would not allow this shroud of unhappiness to descend over Machérie's future, and with unflagging zeal he persuaded first the nobles and then Machérie herself that she need not give up Mont.
So with a soft smile, Machérie gives Mont a single yellow flower. Mont takes to one knee and confesses his love for her. The lovers will be wed, and in each of their hearts blooms a single leonolia.

Luartha relentlessly chased after Kitone as she traveled to request reinforcements to Bordisse Castle. However, she had no intention of impeding Kitone. Partly because she wanted no hand in something that would benefit the Sanctum, but also because she was somewhat awed by Kitone's fervent dedication to her mission.
Luartha was a created being—a homunculus—given the name "Sorrow," but even after escaping this appellation, she continued to lament her own existence. After meeting Viktora and learning what it means to be alive, she sought to live as a human being, and she cared little for which side of the moral line she stood on in order to do so. Continuing to live a life full of laughter would bring an end to her sorrow. Her only hope was to pursue living that way no matter where it might take her.
The woman by Luartha's side hopes that her friend's face will always be covered in a dimpled smile as she pursues the life she desired—and that she will be smiling alongside her as well.

The curtain of night falls. New Year's morning lies in wait for a sleepless city. The anticipation of sparkling parade floats lingers in the air.
A clear, dark, winter sky imitates an earlier time of the day as red lanterns and fireworks shine upon it. Among the hustle and bustle of the marketplace, Resnick hops from shop to shop comparing the holiday decorations—it appears she's especially fond of a lovable little rabbit lantern. A laughing Moore is not too far behind, following Resnick with her a bunny mask in hand. The two appear to feel nothing but merriment.
For once, they can forget all about war, revenge, and a gloomy past; the only thing on their minds in this moment is the hope that the upcoming year will be a peaceful one.

The dancer Addison, who has garnered popularity in another world before appearing in the land of Ardra, and Machérie, who is choosing a dress for her.
Unable to hide her excitement upon seeing the gorgeous queen's wardrobe, Addison is urged by Machérie to try on as many dresses as she wishes.
After selecting her favorite from among the numerous dresses, Addison runs up to Machérie to capture the scene in her magic box, smiling sweetly.
Once known as the Beautiful Steel Maiden, Machérie returns to being any other maiden for just this brief moment—with a gentle expression that was not once seen on the battlefield.

An eventful year is coming to a close. It's a bone-chilling, snowy night. The comforting flames from the fireplace shine a warm glow on the small, humble room. Even without a merry feast or presents to celebrate, a tranquil bliss fills the air. Tyrrell tries desperately to stay awake while watching over Vinera and the baby, but eventually, the three of them are slumbering soundlessly. One wonders what they could be dreaming of.
The door to the room slowly opens, and Raviesse enters, dressed as a gift-giving envoy. She moves as quietly as she can, and though Tyrrell is surprised by her appearance, she offers a silent smile and places a present near the fireplace. Something invaluable lies in wait within the box—a treasure designed to look like a precious somebody who is no longer with them.
No matter the painfully cold days that come to pass, that treasure will be there for them, undoubtedly close to their hearts.

Sold to Hourne at a young age for her shinobi techniques learned in the village of Saiga, Shadowlynx lived as a lonely shadow. Her new life did not even allow her to speak to Kitone, whom she cared for like a younger sister.
But there were many who saw her—and many who felt that this shinobi deserved a new life, better than the one she was dealt.
And thus she returned—like an ugly duckling that matured into a beautiful, graceful swan. Shadowlynx, who has found a new place to which she can belong, may still be one of little words, but she will personify these feelings of gratitude that cannot be conveyed in speech with every fiber of her being.

The midsummer sun hangs high in the sky, and a certain man enjoys the niceties of a life only lived once, lying stretched out on a deck chair on a simmering beach with a refreshing drink in hand. He is none other than Ardra's trailblazer, Jayden.
The rulership-seeking stag and his followers were taking a brief respite on a summer day; Lu'Cia and Creysse are in swimsuits, stretched out and sunbathing; Elan and Chunak are racing each other to the rocks in the shallow waters; and the rest are engaged in an intense match over control of a ball. Everyone looks so happy. One might think Rhaldor is nowhere to be seen…but in the distance he can be spotted running along the sandy beach, training his body to his heart's content—probably the most enjoyable thing he could do on a day off duty.
The smiles of his followers will become their strength. Knowing this, Jayden vowed anew to unify Ardra under that dazzling summer sky.

Lasswell, a knight of Grandshelt who saved the world time and again with his long-time companion Rain, and Jayden, the king of Rundall who aspires to become ruler of the entire continent of Ardra.
Visions of these two men, otherwise living in completely separate circumstances and eras, are brought together by the Will of Light.
Though a misunderstanding causes them to cross swords, they reconcile after learning of their shared fate. Having overcome a myriad of tribulations, they then become trusted comrades, standing side by side against a powerful enemy threatening their world.

Gah hahaha, there's a new boss in town! Show me the lackwits who were calling me a weakling, who said I bring nothing special to the table! Plenty of warriors across the lands claim they'll never die, but I'm the only one who's truly unkillable!
That said, I've come a long way...and it's all thanks to you! And though you may think you see the moment of my demise, make no mistake—I'll live to die another day!

So that she may spend time with the rabbits she so adores, Sylvie puts her skills to use baking pies.
Before long, the rabbits appear, enticed by the appetizing aroma, and the party begins at last.
"Would you like some, too?" she asked with a smile as she placed more pie on the table.
With her affectionate gaze and inviting voice, there are not many who could refuse.
Sylvie's kindness envelopes not only the filling of her pies and the rabbits that enjoy them, but also everyone around her.

The demon dwelled within a sacred tree, and heard the many prayers of those who paid it pilgrimage. These prayers gave shape to her soul, and to the vessel which it would inhabit.
As the years passed, the demon, having heard wish after wish, took an interest in matters of the human heart. She longed to understand humanity.
And so she began to involve herself with humankind: to those seeking salvation, she offered her hand, and to those seeking support, she provided her shoulder in solace.
Eventually the demon became a part of the people's folklore, and her story has been passed down through generations.
When you wish for something, she will surely be there to aid you.

As the swordswoman Rayches, a newly joined member of Hourne's second division «Nitor», was reported to be a potential spy, Machérie took it upon herself to determine the truth of the matter with her own eyes.
Upon summoning Rayches in an attempt to reconfirm her motivation for enlisting, Machérie hears what she had already been told—that Rayches fell in love with Adelard at first sight. Rayches's facial expression during this blunt declaration held not one shred of doubt. She then launched into a lengthy exposition of her love for Adelard, which Machérie decided to lend an ear to now that her suspicions had been quelled.
The sun was setting, and Rayches had finally ceased her chatter, but only after a completely exhausted Machérie had said, "Th-that's enough," multiple times. Alas, Rayches left by saying, "I'd be happy to continue this later...maybe tomorrow?" and it is said that Machérie has been avoiding Rayches for some time now.

During their time together as apprentices in the east, Miranda and Raviesse forged not only an excellent rivalry, but also an unbreakable friendship. Having overcome the hatred in her heart, Raviesse chased mastery ever-higher. Miranda, though she too has grown, had begun to sense the limits of her strength. Their master, Seymore, saw it as well—the impatience and hesitation behind Miranda's blade.
And thus Seymore made the decision to take Miranda to the mainland, in hope that the challenges of a new, more demanding environment would help strengthen her resolve. Raviesse, whom Seymore considered not ready for such trials, remained in the east to further her training. The night before their fated farewell, they faced each other one last time. Through tears they looked proudly upon one another, commending a battle well fought.
When the new day finally dawned, they made a vow to one day meet again—but only after they have each become stronger. Their smiles, though heavy the night before, shined bright with hope for the future.

A demon with a huge, singular eye. Plated in golden armor, this creature commands an air of dignity scarcely attributed to regular Ahriman.
As sworn enemies of virtue, the hordes of demonkind take great pleasure in the degradation of humans, and in any suffering they can cause, no matter how small.
The Golden Ahmiran is no exception—it is said that those unfortunate enough to be enthralled by its enormous eye are sent down a spiral of madness, doomed to a ruinous end.

Garvall seized power by taking over the Arms Dealers' Guild. While his aggressive dealings have earned him a poor reputation as being callous and inhuman, he has succeeded in assuming complete control of the swordsmiths and the weapons trade.
The people of Yezagh shoulder a long history filled with oppression, cruelty, and tragedy. As one of those people, Garvall sees everyone else as an enemy, fit to be used in any way that suits his cold-hearted designs. While he does everything in the name of improving the standing of Yezagh, his actions have ended up being a series of atrocities. Still, in their war-filled world, it was the sole way he could guarantee the survival of his people.
He trusts only in his sister, Velne, and his canine partner who is always by his side. Garvall cared for and protected the dying pup when it was separated from its parents, and since then they have spent many years together. Now considered a cherished member of the family, the beast and Garvall share a powerful bond that will never be broken.

The whole town has been decorated with red ornaments of all manner of shapes and sizes. The main street is so crowded that you cannot move unless you push through people. The sounds of firecrackers exploding come from all directions. In the square, everyone beats musical instruments while great dragons and lions dance vigorously to the rhythm. Then when night comes, red paper lanterns light up the place and spectacular fireworks burst across the skies.
Moore, having just experienced this hustle and bustle that is very different from the town's usual atmosphere, gently pats her favorite tiger and thinks: "We can enjoy these festivities, without a worry in the world, for this is a time of peace. I shall do everything in my power to bring about a greater, longer-lasting period of peace for the people to make the most of."
And so, Moore made this her new year's resolution.

An enormous reptile that has existed since ancient times. Towering over humans with its immense size, it is known for its long neck and tail.
Though it is herbivorous and does not hunt prey, it is an extremely territorial creature that will treat anyone who ventures near as an enemy to attack.
Blows dealt by its colossal frame are nothing short of terrifying, and some of its kind are known to even be capable of wielding magic.
Tales tell of a dreadful forest somewhere in the Farplane that is inhabited by brachiosaurs and other reptiles of old.

One of several sentinel machines discovered at the site of a certain set of ruins, believed to have been a decisive weapon in ancient wars.
Although its creators are long gone, it still dutifully serves as guardian of the ruins.
For the many scholars who wish to unlock the secrets of the ancient technologies, Europa is an alluring subject of study.
However, it is extremely difficult to incapacitate one without destroying it, given that it immediately attacks every human it encounters.

Cadia, Meriluke, Cherise, and Minwu form the core of Glaciela's private brigade, «Spirare», a force that is independent of the Wezette army.
Cadia is Glaciela's half-sister of a different father; she helped to found «Spirare» in order to protect her people. Meriluke was recruited into «Spirare» by Glaciela when the former found herself adrift, unable to settle into the Wezette army. Cherise is a close childhood friend of Glaciela's, almost an older sister. Minwu once blew up Wezette's magic research institute in a thaumaturgical incident, but thereafter found a place at Glaciela's side.
These four, for their own individual reasons, have committed themselves to protecting Glaciela, fighting for the future of Wezette, and ending the long, bitter winter that grips their land.

During their exploration of a certain place, three heroes from a distant world encounter individuals who resemble their past targets—people who had long since undergone changes of heart.
When they discover that these are Cognitions, they attempt to hunt them down, but find themselves transported to an unfamiliar place...
The three friends unanimously decide to continue their pursuit of the mysterious cognitive entities, while also searching for a way to return to their original world.

The heavily falling snow obstructs their field of vision, preventing the allied armies from advancing. Lilyth struggles to hold back the never-ending onslaught of enemy troops, at a loss as to whether to retreat for the time being. It only takes a moment's hesitation—an enemy’s blade finds an opening, which Lilyth parries just in the nick of time.
Thinking that a retreat was the only choice after all, she prepares to give the signal to her troops, but a magical blast from Kilphe tears through the air right before her eyes. Lilyth raises her head hearing Kilphe's encouraging words, "Now is not the time to retreat!" When her legs froze in that moment of hesitation, it was Adelard's encouraging voice that echoed, "I have your back!"
Though they once crossed blades as enemies, the group now trusts their lives to one another on the battlefield. At the end of this road lies a future where all can go forward side by side, without any war or strife. Steeled in this belief, Lilyth blazes across the battlefield once more.

Zazan puts his blade to work as a Gouga shinobi, yet the path he has tread is surrounded by mystery. His almost abnormal attachment to life gives him vitality that is nothing short of extraordinary, which has in turn allowed him to get through countless hairy situations that would leave most in the grave. These survival skills came to him instinctively, and have kept him alive since his youth.
Preferring to act alone, Zazan always kept to himself while in the Gouga village, but after taking on a mission with Rairyuu, the two of them began to work together more often—the pair of cold-blooded killers were all but made for each other.
Time flowed on, and eventually the War of Lion's Valley came to an end. Rairyuu had met his fate, but from time to time Zazan thinks back on the memorable meals and drinks they shared, fully intent on relishing life to the fullest in place of his fallen partner.

A giant monster clad in refined iron armor, boasting superior attack and defense. Even its bare skin is as tough as metal. Thus, it is no mistake to assume that its defensive capabilities are far more advanced than what meets the eye. Its attacks are sharp and surprisingly swift for a giant clad in heavy armor. It is thought that the Iron Giant itself is being propelled into battle by some manner of magic or incantations.

A four-legged beast layered in unyielding muscle. It is the very definition of a monster; just from the looks of it, no man in his right mind would think to raise his sword against the Behemoth. It appears to be more of a chaotic collection of malevolent parts than a single entity. It bears the fat, sharp horns of a devil, a thick lion's mane, and long, spiky thorns trailing down its back like a dragon. It has even been known to run on its hind legs like a human, though few have borne witness to such a fearsome sight. The most efficient way of handling a beast such as the Behemoth is to flee, but if facing it is inevitable, be certain to fight from a distance and be prepared for a long, grueling battle.

A revolting plant-type monster with eye-like sensory organs, rows and rows of sharp fangs, and dozens of tendrils trailing around its body like so many tentacles. Though the sight of its undulating form is enough to overwhelm anybody, the true fear lies in the foul breath it belches forth. Those hit with the Malboro's foul breath will be poisoned, blinded, and sent into a haze of consciousness where there is no telling friend from foe—all before being gobbled up by the putrid beast.

"I wonder if Lord Sterne will accept my chocolate..."
"What's wrong, Etre? Your hand is stopped. Nasha is already almost finished. I'll be finished pretty soon here, too."
"Hm? You're done with that? Yerma, what...what are you making?"
"It's obviously chocolate, is it not?"
"Uh, really? Wow... It smells intense... You sure something didn't go wrong here, Yerma?"
"Intense is right. This isn't just chocolate; it's a soup full of delicious ingredients. When Lord Sterne drinks this he'll surely... Hehehe."
"More like his life will be in danger if he drinks this! We have to stop her, Nasha!"
"Oh Lord Sterne, please no! My little heart is unprepared...!"
"Alright that's enough daydreaming everyone!"

On that day, all of Leonis was enveloped in cheers of joy, for the king's long-awaited child—two children, in fact—had been born. The cheers were all the louder as this also meant the birth of the prince who would one day reign over the land. Amidst the citizens' cheering voices—echoing so loud they shook the very walls of the castle—those close to the king whispered their concerns that twins would lead only to strife over who would ascend the throne. However, King Oelde laughed them away, confident that having twins would ensure the continuation of the royal bloodline. Though typically a brazen-faced king, on this day alone his smile would not fade. Queen Helena was overjoyed as well, but no one could be happier at the birth of these boys than Oelde himself.

A shinobi's orders can be quite varied—relaying messages, gathering intelligence, manipulating the public, or even conducting assassinations—and not all of them wrap up cleanly. Kitone has served the royal family of Leonis since she was young, but the truth of the matter is that she was bought into that service. Willing or otherwise, the only road before her is following the king's orders. As Fennes continues its ominous movements, Kitone receives more secret orders to protect the leading figures of Leonis. Her small, cat-like frame proves to be a great asset for her as a shinobi. Relying on her agile movements and surprising strength, she has yet to leave a single mission unaccomplished.

They were but children on the day they met, when young Schuzelt burst into Naiah's room unexpectedly holding a stray kitten that was to be put down by an irate sanitations officer. At the time, Naiah was little more than a taciturn homebody, but hearing Schuzelt talk of the world sparked in her a curiosity that eventually led the two of them on walks through the town. Naiah learned the ways of the white mage to be of aid to Schuzelt, and together they were quite successful in vanquishing monsters. The days turned into months, and on Naiah's twenty-fifth birthday, Schuzelt revealed his emotions with that one-and-only question. And of course, she said yes.

Shadowlynx came under the employ of the Hourne royal family when she was just a child. She was placed in the palace as both a guard and a playmate to Princess Machérie, although the princess's natural tomboyishness often left her unsure of how to behave. Whenever Shadowlynx needed a short respite from her duties, she would visit the cat she kept in a small hideaway outside the royal capital. Just a few moments of playtime with her precious pet is enough to melt away the woes of the world and ease the crease in her brow. Even now that she has grown and been selected to serve by King Robb's side, that fact has not changed.

Lilyth, commander of «Caelum», and her right-hand woman Ramada take a moment to read the stars. Though they are both knights, Lilyth is more the type to cut through the vanguard while Ramada would assess the situation calmly from afar. Nevertheless, Lilyth seeks counsel from Ramada for all manner of things, and Ramada trusts Lilyth deeply in their mutual duty to protect Prince Mont. The moments they cherish the most are those when they're raising a toast to something they accomplished together. Their mugs are filled to the brim with Ramada's specially brewed tea. The conversation flowing between them is jovial and lighthearted—although sometimes it's filled with colorful rumors about the boys accompanying them.

King Khury of Wezette is well known for his skills as a bowman. "The art of the bow," he says, "lies in predicting every situation and focusing—dare I say, sharpening—your senses to the utmost degree." Doing so will lead the arrow where it was meant to go and ensure that one's quarry is rightfully caught. Even when presiding over his kingdom, Khury looks not only at what unfolds before him, but what lies beyond as well. It may seem that Wezette engages in acts to the benefit of its enemies—or even to the betrayal of its allies. However, this is simply Khury using his sharpened senses to truly see where dies are already cast and where they can yet be molded. Many consider Khury both cunning and calculated, though just as many praise him as a rare and benevolent king.
Here a new adventure begins in a world where light ushers all unto oblivion. But hope is not yet lost, for where there is light there is shadow.

"I am told that this attire is worn in a distant land to celebrate auspicious occasions."
"It is quite difficult to maneuver in, but it has grown on me. I rather like it."
"I'm glad you approve. It suits you well, Machérie."
"As it does you, Mont. By the way, what sort of celebrations are there to be had? I assume this wooden racket is for beating down our enemies?"
"A-ahhh... I don't think that's exactly what that's for..."

Half human and half serpent, the lamia is a fearsome creature. Much worse is its salacious leader, the Lamia Queen. While lamiae often feature bewitching feminine traits, the Lamia Queen in particular is said to be unrivaled in her beauty.
Many have been seduced simply by hearing about her in legend. Such impressionable souls no doubt end up as her brainwashed pets—that is, until she grows bored and swallows them whole.

Sadali Crysthea's elite guards, known to follow him like a shadow and protect him from all looming threats. Though the three may appear quite unassuming, they are more than capable of halting enemy invasions in their tracks, and their offensive talents equal the might of an entire army. This power that Sadali so dearly relies on helps to elevate the status of the Sanctum to that of other great nations.
As they rarely speak beyond addressing Sadali himself, they remain an enigma even to those within the Church of the Crystal. That said, while they admittedly bear unique features indicative of a difference in age, there is something familiar about their pristine faces hidden behind those masks that has sparked rumors about them being sisters.

There was a span of roughly two years when Lilyth was away from Leonis. The catalyst for this was her younger brother Volke's death during the war with Fennes. Clutching his lacerated body, she vowed to set out for revenge. As for what exactly happened during those two years, she is not moved to divulge the details, even to Mont. Be it as it may that she has always been an outstanding swordswoman, it is not difficult to imagine how her intention to exact revenge on the king of an entire nation all by herself was a reckless endeavor. It is said that she devotedly pursued Muraga's ceaselessly battling military forces across cold climates and rugged terrain, seeking just a single momentary opening. Most of the scars covering her body are from this period. Though she ultimately returned without having achieved revenge, her eyes are still alert to any possible chance of exacting it.

A massive plantoid monster with a body the size of a small hill. It features a gaping maw with pointed fangs, as well as innumerable tendrils resembling a catfish's whiskers. From poison to paralysis, it is known for its ability to induce a number of harmful abnormalities on the human body. It characteristically shakes its body when agitated, an appearance which has been likened to a dance of sorts. It is not uncommon to see individual specimens accompanied by multiple juvenile microchus.

This world is not your home. Having lost your memory, you find yourself here, in Palamecia. There are many other outlanders who have drifted here, their memories lost. Having been wiped of your past, you are known as "Blanks." Though you may have lost your past, you still have the future.
There is a prophecy in Palamecia, and it goes like this: "One day the Warrior of Light shall appear and restore hope to the land."
Could it be that one among the Blanks—perhaps even you—are the prophesized Warrior of Light?
Fight for the future, and bring hope to Palamecia!

Adelard, commander of Hourne's Second Division, «Nitor», is a red mage who consistently displays sophisticated swordsmanship and magical prowess without ever losing his composure. His one weakness, however, is his younger sister and sole blood relative, Salire, a black mage in the same division.
Compared to Adelard, who only ever softens his demeanor when his sister is present, Salire never tries to hide her love for her older brother. Even when on duty, she does her best to not become separated and goes to extremes to keep anyone and everyone away from him. As Adelard's looks and reputation attract many courters, it is needless to say that women find themselves on the receiving end of Salire's endless jealousy, though it would seem that even men and domesticated animals are not exempt from it either.

"Huh, for us? But it looks so expensive..." "I said it when I handed it over and I'll say it again: Little Lala and I only gave you chocolate out of a sense of obligation. You get that, right?" "Of course I get it, Sosha. I just wanted to show my appreciation for you always taking care of me. And it's nothing to write home about, really." "Hey Little Lolly, have we ever taken care of him?" "Ugh, Sosha. Weren't you the one playing Cupid for him before? See, you've got something even better prepared for Ramada, right Vallaide?" "Of course! Everything's ready to go. Well, except that I'm a tad worried about the fact that I never received anything from her in the first place!"

The marriage of Dario, prince of Hourne, and Vinera, princess of Fennes, was a political marriage designed to connect the two hostile nations. However, a sinister plot was brewing in the background.
Although the citizens of Hourne and Fennes put on smiles to celebrate the marriage, not a single person actually thought it would be a happy one...besides the prince and princess themselves, that is.
Without an inkling of each other's personality or appearance, the two were made to meet just before being bound in matrimony. It was not the case that they had mutually sought each other out, and although it was a relationship heavy with obligation and responsibility, he wrapped her in his arms and greeted her as a husband greets a wife, and her heart went on to open up further every time she encountered that kindness thereafter.
Whatever the circumstances and intentions surrounding their union had been, it eventually turned into a true binding of souls.

Chocobos are characterized by their fluffy, yellow plumage. In reality, however, their coats come in a variety of colors due to differences in heredity and environment. Among them, red-feathered chocobos are particularly temperamental and aggressive, earning them the moniker "red chocobos."
Many wild chocobos live near a particular river in a distant world—including this red variety—and it is said that their powerful legs move easily even in areas with poor footing and that they can summon small meteorites. Those who have encountered a flock of these chocobos in their travels claim them to be most frightening of foes.

In a distant world, people have taken to forming villages near crystals in order to protect themselves from the harmful miasma covering the land.
As the crystals must be purified once a year with drops of myrrh from a tree of the same name, young villagers set out each year to collect these drops, a crystal chalice containing a shard of the crystal in hand.
These groups of young people setting out in search of drops of myrrh are referred to as crystal caravans.

A monster whose name means "stripping away the spirit." Though its existence has been known and feared for ages, many mysteries about its ecology remain. Despite possessing great intelligence and magical prowess, it is unknown whether it has human-like feelings or can communicate via language. Some theories suggest that these creatures eat the brains of intelligent life-forms to acquire their knowledge and that they were once human. But one thing remains clear: everyone who has fought a mindflayer has suffered great spiritual damage. Even if they emerge victorious, none are willing to face one again.

It is a little-known fact that Oldoa of Muraga's royal guard has an unmatched affinity for cute animals. This affinity, however, fails to reach the objects of her affection more often than not. Though she adores them enough to stop marching while on duty if they are spotted on the wayside, animals take her hair and armor as a threat and run away frightened.
Kilphe, watching this unfold nearby, is aware of why these animals fear Oldoa, but she says nothing. It would appear that seeing Oldoa despair over being rejected by her beloved animals brings a smile to her lips.

Among the warring states of Ardra, there are four kings said to stand above the rest.
There is King Robb of westerly Hourne, with his vast dominion and great military might, who is known to be a broad-minded man. To the east is King Khury of Wezette, who is prudent yet high-strung and governs strictly over a frigid land, and whose kingdom has since many generations prior been in an antagonistic relationship with Hourne.
Between these two nations is Fennes to the north—ruled by the violent and bold King Muraga—and Leonis to the south—ruled by King Oelde, who has established a presence despite governing a small nation thanks to his resourcefulness and strategic ingenuity.
These four nations preserve a balance nigh miraculous, and while there has yet to be a major war to date, the equilibrium is now gradually collapsing as Lord Sadali of the Crystal Sanctum begins to take action.

An evil spirit that has taken the form of a moon. Red in color, it appears as though it has been stained with freshly spilled blood. Legends passed down through the ages claim it to be an omen of disaster, bringing misfortune and death to those who catch sight of it.
Unless the strong magical attacks emitted from its eerie smile are dealt with, it will easily reap the souls of its opponents.
